docs.snippet: YOU'D be better informed if, instead of listening to what we say, you watch what we do.''    That excellent advice was not issued by Enron management, although it should have been. Instead it came more than 30 years ago from John N. Mitchell, Pres...
docs.lead_paragraph: YOU'D be better informed if, instead of listening to what we say, you watch what we do.'' That excellent advice was not issued by Enron management, although it should have been. Instead it came more than 30 years ago from John N. Mitchell, President Richard M. Nixon's attorney general.
docs.abstract: Floyd Norris observes that Enron's restatement of earnings should cause investors and Wall Street analysts to realize they have been fooled by so-called pro forma earnings, which leave out unpleasant realities and ignore accounting rules (M)

headline.main: Does Enron Trust Its New Numbers? It Doesn't Act Like It

docs.snippet: The Enron Corporation named Jeffrey Skilling as its chief executive today, promoting a manager who helped make the company into the largest competitor in the growing energy-trading business.    Mr. Skilling, 47, who was president and chief operati...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Enron Corporation named Jeffrey Skilling as its chief executive today, promoting a manager who helped make the company into the largest competitor in the growing energy-trading business. Mr. Skilling, 47, who was president and chief operating officer, succeeds Ken Lay, 58. Mr. Lay said he would continue as chairman, a position he has held since February 1986.
docs.abstract: Enron Corp names Jeffrey Skilling chief executive, succeeding Ken Lay, who continues as chairman (N)

headline.main: Enron Rewards President With Promotion to Chief Executive

docs.snippet: The Enron Corporation said yesterday that it had rejected a bid from an unnamed suitor for its controlling stake in the Enron Oil and Gas Company because the offer was too low. Enron said in December that it had received an unsolicited offer for i...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Enron Corporation said yesterday that it had rejected a bid from an unnamed suitor for its controlling stake in the Enron Oil and Gas Company because the offer was too low. Enron said in December that it had received an unsolicited offer for its 53.5 percent stake in the separately traded Enron Oil and Gas. Enron would not disclose who had made the bid. Oil and natural gas prices have surged as much as 50 percent this year, lifting stocks of exploration companies like Enron Oil and Gas. Its shares, which closed yesterday at $18.75, up 37.5 cents, have climbed 48 percent since the offer was disclosed Dec. 15. Enron's stake in Enron Oil and Gas is valued at about $1.6 billion, based on current stock prices. The oil exploration company has a total market value of $2.9 billion.
docs.abstract: Enron Corp says it rejected bid from unnamed suitor for controlling stake in Enron Oil and Gas Co (S)

headline.main: ENRON REJECTS BID FOR STAKE IN OIL AND GAS UNIT

docs.snippet: Angered by renegotiation of a $2.8 billion power project with the Enron Corporation, dissidents in a right-wing party denounced their leader today and warned the United States company to quit India.         It was one of the few public protests ag...
docs.lead_paragraph: Angered by renegotiation of a $2.8 billion power project with the Enron Corporation, dissidents in a right-wing party denounced their leader today and warned the United States company to quit India. It was one of the few public protests against the stand of the Bharatiya Janata Party, which shares power in the government of Maharashtra state, where Enron plans to build a huge power generation plant.

headline.main: Enron Plant Is Target Of India Dissidents

docs.snippet: The ruling was the first test case of laws introduced to speed the transfer of suspected terrorists....
docs.lead_paragraph: Three British bankers may be extradited to the United States to face Enron-related fraud charges, the High Court ruled on Tuesday in a ruling that was the first test case of laws introduced to speed the transfer of suspected terrorists. The bankers -- David Bermingham, Gary Mulgrew and Giles Darby, former executives at Greenwich NatWest, a unit of the Royal Bank of Scotland Group -- had argued that because the majority of the reported offenses took place in Britain any trial should be held here and that their deportation to the United States would contravene European human rights laws.

headline.main: British Court Backs Extradition Of Three in Enron-Related Case

docs.snippet: Kenneth D. Rice, the former head of Enron's high-speed Internet unit, pleaded guilty Friday to one count of securities fraud and agreed to cooperate with federal prosecutors pursuing other cases related to the company's collapse.    Mr. Rice, 45, ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Kenneth D. Rice, the former head of Enron's high-speed Internet unit, pleaded guilty Friday to one count of securities fraud and agreed to cooperate with federal prosecutors pursuing other cases related to the company's collapse. Mr. Rice, 45, faces up to 10 years in prison and a fine of up to $1 million. Sentencing was set for Jan. 31. The plea agreement with prosecutors also requires him to forfeit $13.7 million in cash and property that includes jewelry and two sports cars.
docs.abstract: Kenneth D Rice, former head of Enron's high-speed Internet unit, pleads guilty to one count of securities fraud and agrees to cooperate with federal prosecutors pursuing other cases related to company's collapse; Rice faces up to 10 years in prison and fine of up to $1 million; sentencing is set for Jan 31; plea agreement also requires Rice to forfeit $13.7 million in cash and property; photo (M)

docs.snippet: Enron traders discussed manipulating the California power market in telephone calls in which they gloated about ripping off ''those poor grandmothers'' in the energy crisis in 2000-2001, according to transcripts of the calls that have been release...
docs.lead_paragraph: Enron traders discussed manipulating the California power market in telephone calls in which they gloated about ripping off ''those poor grandmothers'' in the energy crisis in 2000-2001, according to transcripts of the calls that have been released. The calls were obtained from the government and transcribed by a public utility district near Seattle that wants Enron to forfeit millions of dollars in gains over the scandal. Investigators said the transcripts painted a sordid picture of rigging the market amid widespread blackouts and soaring electricity rates. The transcripts also shed light on discussions central to the Justice Department investigation of Enron.
docs.abstract: Transcripts of calls between Enron energy traders reveals them gloating about ripping off 'poor grandmothers' during energy crisis of 2000-2001 and discussing rigging California market amid widespread blackouts and soaring electric rates; transcripts were obtained from government as part of Washington state utility's lawsuit against Enron (S)

headline.main: Enron Traders' Calls Gloated About Cheating

docs.snippet: Stocks sank yesterday as Enron teetered on the brink of one of the biggest corporate implosions in United States history and added to the debate swirling around the market's powerful run-up.    ''The market has come awfully far, awfully fast,'' sa...
docs.lead_paragraph: Stocks sank yesterday as Enron teetered on the brink of one of the biggest corporate implosions in United States history and added to the debate swirling around the market's powerful run-up. ''The market has come awfully far, awfully fast,'' said Jon Brorson, director of equities for Northern Trust, which manages more than $300 billion. ''Enron is weighing on it, too. I think people are a little squeamish as to the reverberations, and it's a great excuse to take some profits.''
docs.abstract: Enron Corp implosion causes stock markets to sink; Dow Jones industrial average drops 160.74 points, to 9,711.86; Standard & Poor's 500-stock index closes at 1,128.52, down 20.98 points; Nasdaq composite index drops 48.00 points, to 1,887.97; graphs (M)

headline.main: Investors Pull Back as Enron Drags Down Key Indexes

docs.snippet: The Bombay High Court dismissed a petition today seeking to again stop the Enron Corporation from pursuing a power project on the west coast of India.    Sanjay Bhatnagar, vice president of Enron's Indian subsidiary, the Dabhol Power Company, said...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bombay High Court dismissed a petition today seeking to again stop the Enron Corporation from pursuing a power project on the west coast of India. Sanjay Bhatnagar, vice president of Enron's Indian subsidiary, the Dabhol Power Company, said after the ruling that work was expected to begin within weeks.
docs.abstract: Bombay High Court dismisses petition seeking to stop Enron Corp from pursuing power project on west coast of India (S)

headline.main: Indian Court Backs Enron on Power Project

docs.snippet: In an unusual twist, the three men were released under the supervision of a defense lawyer....
docs.lead_paragraph: In an unusual twist, the three men were released under the supervision of a defense lawyer.
